text: The 2016 FIBA 3x3 Under-18 Asian Championships for Boys and Girls is the second edition of the FIBA Asia's 3x3 championship for boys and girls under the age of 18. The games were held at the Gem In Mall in Cyberjaya, Malaysia from 22-24 July. Qatar and Japan won the boys and girls tournaments respectively. ==Boys== ===Preliminary round=== ====Group A==== {| |- | |} | {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Pts Ave |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|20.5 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|19.2 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|18.2 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|18.8 |- |10.5 |} |} ====Group B==== {| |- | |} | {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center;" |- !Pts Ave |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|21.0 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|19.5 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|19.2 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|12.5 |- |8.2 |} |} ===Knockout round=== ==Girls== ===Preliminary round=== ====Group A==== {| |- | |} | {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Pts Ave |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|12.0 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|15.5 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|14.0 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|15.2 |- |13.8 |} |} ====Group B==== {| |- | |} | {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Pts Ave |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|21.0 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|19.5 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|19.2 |- |style="background:#ccffcc;"|12.5 |- |8.2 |} |} ===Knockout round=== ==References== 2016 Category:International basketball competitions hosted by Malaysia Category:2016–17 in Asian basketball Category:2016–17 in Malaysian basketball Category:2016 in 3x3 basketball
